intro: Physedra heterophylla, commonly known as the variable bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It is characterized by its specialized bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms. The plant exhibits morphological variation, with different leaf shapes depending on its environment. It is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, known for its carnivorous tendencies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and nutrient acquisition.
